citation.article-title: A novel species of thermoacidophilic archaeon, Sulfolobus yangmingensis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Sulfolobus yangmingensis sp. nov.
Sulfolobus yangmingensis (yang.ming.en'sis. M.L. adj. yangmingensis pertaining to the Yang-Ming National Park, Taiwan, Republic of China, from where the organism was isolated)
Sulfolobus yangmingensis is a lobed, spherical, thermoacidophilic archaeon with a cell diameter of 1.1±O.2 μm.
The optimal pH and temperature for growth are 4.0 (range 2.0-6.0) and 80°C (range 65-95°C).
It is versatile in its nutritional requirements.
The G + C content of the genomic DNA is 42 mol%.
The major cellular lipids are calditoglycerocaldarchaeol and caldarchaeol.
The level of DNA homology and the computer analysis of 16s rRNA sequence distinguish it as a new species.
The type strain of Sulfolobus yangmingensis is YM1T, which was isolated from an acidic, muddy hot spring.
